title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message:
Hi, after a bit of a break from board repair due to personal reasons im back at it again! I bought this A1502 13" late 2013 retina which has a super weird issue! It works just fine for a while but after like 30 minutes it cuts out and sometimes won't power up until you let it sit for a while. I already ruled out the battery and thermal issues.
Anyone know what could be causing this?

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: Try to clean ME region...

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: Do I need an external Programmer for this?

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: Yes, if you don't have Medusa programmer...

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: Wouldn't swapping the SPI Flash from a donor do the same job?

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message:
NO.
You need clean ME region.
The PCH is married with its SPI chip, once the board is booted.

Upload somewhere your BIOS, if you cannot clean ME region.

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message:
Yup, maybe should get one soon. Also now found out what is the reason for the crashes according to macOS as I finally got a log... Is that of any use?

Will try the new EFI file you sent today. Will report back on what happens.

BTW as Long as the Machine is on all the Time and never goes to sleep it appears stable (8h uptime)

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message:
Any problem if you close/open the lid?
Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger?

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: No seems to work fine. The only thing I found weird (could also be an OS Bug though) is that it goes to sleep while playing YouTube.... Yes original charger, though this reboot was on a genuine battery

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: Test it with USB macOS.

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: Okay, after nearly a year back on this machine. I now flashed the full new bios 2informaticos posted in the thread. This changed things. Those sleep/wake error messages upon panic are gone now. But I still wouldn’t consider it 100%, although it’s a lot better. The machine still occasionally doesn’t wake from sleep, instead rebooting. Also Apple services aren’t working, but that’s likely just a product of the different BIOS. This is honestly one of my most annoying machines I’ve ever seen…

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message:
Try this now...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oi9HQfr_3BX7E-oyDv5nEKvhGo3F5LZN/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message:
Should I also do a reinstall after flashing the new one?

though I might have to do this anyway as the new EFI probably has no APFS support…

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message:
Fresh instal is better, you can discard any software issue in this case.
Don't forget to make PRAM reset first.

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: So okay got this done. Bt apple services are still an issue. Well at least FaceTime and iMessage. I tried both my old install and also a fresh install I put on an external SSD. What happens is with iMessage I can sign in like normal but after like 10s I get thrown into the login screen again... For FaceTime it does a similar thing where I log in but it just goes back to the login screen. In terms of stability, I can't really comment on it but it seems fine for now. Oh, and I did a PRAM reset.

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: Should I post this in a separate thread instead?

title: A1502 820-3536A working, but turns off after about 30 minutes
message: Okay issues are sadly still there. Machine occasionally just turns off while using it and after a night in sleep I once found it back on the login screen after a reboot. No error messages though...
